alert.note: Alert for Erie; Niagara (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 10:36AM EST until January 27 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following counties, Erie and Niagara. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 AM EST, local law enforcement reported an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Up to 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. Ice jams on smaller tributaries could aggravate swollen rivers. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Williamsville, Grand Island, Elma, Eden and Pendleton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
